Warner Bros. Corporation (WBC) is an upcoming American multinational mass media and entertainment conglomerate headquartered in New York City. It will be formed after the Split of Warner Bros. Discovery by April 2026.
The company's consists of the flagship Warner Bros. studios, HBO, DC Entertainment and the streaming service HBO Max.
Assets
* Warner Bros. Corporation consists of assets including Warner Bros. Entertainment and its units, Warner Bros. Theatre Ventures, Warner Bros. Home Entertainment, Turner Entertainment, The Wolper Organization, WaterTower Music and Warner Bros. Studio Operations.
** Warner Bros. Motion Picture Group consists of the company's filmed entertainment and theatrical entertainment businesses, including Warner Bros. Pictures, New Line Cinema, Warner Bros. Pictures Animation and Castle Rock Entertainment. The division is led by former MGM executives Michael De Luca and Pamela Abdy.
** Warner Bros. Television Group consists of domestic and international network of television production companies, including the flagship Warner Bros. Television Studios label, alongside Telepictures, Alloy Entertainment, Warner Bros. Animation, Cartoon Network Studios, Williams Street, and Warner Horizon Unscripted Television. The division is also responsible for 12.5% of The CW along with the CBS Entertainment Group unit of Paramount Skydance Corporation. The division is led by Channing Dungey.
** Warner Bros. Streaming manages the operations of the company's direct-to-consumer platforms, online brands and gaming businesses, including the streaming service HBO Max, the video game publisher Warner Bros. Games, and the now-defunct digital media company Rooster Teeth. It also houses Home Box Office, Inc., the parent company of the HBO and Cinemax premium television services and production studios.
** Warner Bros. Global Experiences manages Warner Bros. theme parks and studio tours. Additional business segments include divisions responsible for Global Content Distribution (Warner Bros. Worldwide Television Distribution), and Advertising Sales.
** DC Entertainment oversees DC Comics and Mad. It works with other WBD units and delves into those units within their flagship DC Universe franchise.
** DC Studios oversees DC Comics and is the film and series production sites of WBD for DC media in the new film and series franchise DC Universe.
